ygData.subject: Re: Level 50 options was:RE: Instruments vs. Melee quandry
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually my main char was a Dark Elf and guess what. You rarely run to the guards. For the most part most newbies of the evil races rarely run to the guards. I
ygData.messageBody:
Actually my main char was a Dark Elf and guess what. You rarely run to the
guards. For the most part most newbies of the evil races rarely run to the
guards. I really don't think it's necessary to run to the guards you don't
lose any expierence at levels 1-5 and then when you do it's easyto gain it
back. Personally I have no problem with people killing guards. I also don't
see why others complainbecause it gets you ready for the higher levels when
there are no guards around to help.

Naeeldar

Richard Ashkettle wrote:
>
> From: Richard Ashkettle <richard_ashkettle@...>
>
> OK,
> BEFORE this gets KABONG'd..and it will, no doubt.
>
> You have hit on my PERSONAL PET PEEVE. NOTHING annoys
> my more than level 50 people, bored, sitting in Newbie
> zones and killing the guards there.
>
> Last night, there was a level 50 Warrior sitting in
> Rivervale killing the Town guards. Not the Wall
> guards, where the average player who runs to them is
> level 5 to 12, but the town ones...where the only
> players running to them is around level 1 to 3.
> I spent 2 hours helping every newbie I could there
> (with my Cleric, so I could heal them). Its hard
> enough for a newbie to start on older servers, without
> high level IDIOTS making things tougher on them for a
> lark (NOTE: It was on MM, and No, it was NOT
> Shada...)
>
> Everyone kills the Inky guards in Nek forest. That
> must make life Soooo fun for the New Dark Elf players.
> All I'm asking is that you THINK about your actions
> BEFORE you do something that may have such an impact.
>
> Windolas Stormsong (MM)
